name: Suave Leading Men Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: George Sanders was as urbane and sophisticated as anyone could be. Which is NOT one of his movies?
questions.explanation:
'The Best Years of Our Lives'.

	All are good movies.

questions.text: James Mason played a smooth movie star in 'A Star Is Born'. Who played the 'star'?
questions.explanation:
Judy Garland.

	Great manner of speaking.

questions.text: Maurice Chevalier is known for singing 'Thank Heaven for Little Girls' in 'Gigi'. Who played the male romantic lead opposite Leslie Caron?
Sean Connery was the first (and the best) James Bond. He also made other movies; which of the following is NOT one of them?
questions.explanation:
'Rollerball'.

	All were pretty weak efforts. 'Rollerball' was James Caan.

questions.text: David Niven starred in 'The Bishop's Wife'. Who played the title role?
Tyrone Power was best known for his good looks. Which was NOT one of his movies?
Van Johnson also capitalized on his looks. Which movie included him in the cast?
questions.explanation:
'Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo'.

	'Eagles' featured Richard Burton, who could also be on this list.

questions.text: Cary Grant - the ultimate charmer - starred with Grace Kelly in 'To Catch a Thief'. Who played Kelly's mother?
Grant seems to get killed in 'North by Northwest'. Where does this event take place?
questions.explanation:
National Park.

	See comment to preceding question.

questions.text: Grant starred with Audrey Hepburn in 'Charade'. What was the valuable item that turned up at the movie's end?
